lines.text: For me it's simple. A golf course is for golf. A tennis court is for tennis. A prison camp is for escaping.
Frontiers are an invention of men. Nature doesn't give a hoot.
May I ask you a question?
Of course.
Why did you make an exception of me by inviting me here?
Because your name is Boeldieu, career officer in the French Army. And I am Rauffenstein, career officer in the Imperial German Army.
But my comrades are officers as well.
A 'Maréchal' and 'Rosenthal,' officers?
They're fine soldiers.
Charming legacy of the French Revolution.
Neither you nor I can stop the march of time.
Boldieu, I don't know who will win this war, but whatever the outcome, it will mean the end of the Rauffensteins and the Boeldieus.
We're no longer needed.
Isn't that a pity?
Perhaps.
Out there, children play soldier...
In here, soldiers play like children.
May the earth lie lightly upon our valiant enemy.
I think we can do nothing to stop the march of time.
Believe me, I don't know who is going to win this war the end, whatever it is will be the end of the Rauffensteins and the Boeldieus.
So you're digging a hole like Monte Cristo. What a laugh.
More coffee sir?
If you call this muck coffee I have to accept it. At least it warms my insides.
The theater's too deep for me. I prefer bicycling.
Is that supposed to be witty?
I hate the way German bulletins exaggerate.
And our papers don't? Remember "the Russian steamroller"?
